website_summaries.verdict: A worthy peer to speakers by Bose and Jawbone, the Sony SRS-BTX500 is one of the best premium portable Bluetooth speakers you can buy.
pros: The Sony SRS-BTX500 is a sleekly designed Bluetooth wireless speaker that offers impressive sound for its size, and has a built-in rechargeable battery for on-the-go use, and speakerphone capabilities
A carrying case is included and there's a USB port for charging smartphones when the AC adapter is plugged in
The NFC pairing feature is a nice bonus for new phones that are so equipped
cons: The speaker's fairly expensive and the battery life is OK but not great

customer_reviews.title: Portable but best suited as a bookshelf or headboard speaker due to its size and weight. Very attractive design.
customer_reviews.text: first unit was DOA on arrival, Amazon took care of it immediately and the second one works flawlessly. It is big and heavy and suited best for home use but is portable and rechargeable. Battery did not last 12 hours as (I think) was stated somewhere, but it did go 9-10 hrs at lower volume, such as ambient music where you also want to have conversations. Good bass and mid range, the highs are a little muddy at lower volumes which is the leve I use it for most of the time..
customer_reviews.author: Allie Rae

customer_reviews.title: Love this speaker
customer_reviews.text: Had the speaker for over year now and it is great. The sound quality is top notch and it is easily able to fill a large room with sound. The bluetooth signal reaches a good distance, and I have not had any problems with sound clarity over the bluetooth connection. The battery seems to last forever when it is not in used, and when in use I have not been able to run it out of juice (used for two hours straight multiple times). Overall a great unit for a reasonable price.

customer_reviews.title: Great sound for its size

The only reason I didn't give it five stars is because it is somewhat heavy and doesn't have a good means (like a handle or a slot for fingers) to carry it around the house. The vocals (like lectures, guided meditation tracks) sound open and clear on this drive.

The Bass was anemic. When you enabled their synthetic bass boost. The Midrange disappeared !! The Bose Sound Link II blew it away.
customer_reviews.author: mswlogo

customer_reviews.title: Close but no cigar!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Sony made an attempt to bring wireless sound to us. Not bad,close but no cigar!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: herbejl

customer_reviews.title: Rechargable batteir quit work quickly
customer_reviews.text: The rechargeable battery did not hold up and Sony would not stand behind it! I would not recommend this item!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Thomsen

customer_reviews.title: Most disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Most disappointing. After all the reviews giving this speaker a top rating, it's sound is truly mediocre. I've had better sound from speakers that were one tenth the price. I don't get it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Kalm

customer_reviews.title: cheap useless product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product after reading all the so good things about it from the reviews. Pros: Non Cons: - Bulky and big and not for travel at all - terrible sound - doesn't connect through AUX form any source - very low sound for phone calls-Awful - terrible to connect and so much hassles to connect it - Expensive for the money
customer_reviews.author: Optimistic

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great sound! Easy to use. The only things I wish it had is a little more volume and a car charger, but I can deal with it.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Carey
